I am certainly an ally for the LGBT community, but the military is not supposed to be sensitive. Gender should play no factor. You don't go into the military with the expectation that you will be allowed to express yourself. When you join the military, they own you. That goes for everyone.

I don't indulge so I don't know a lot about different types of wine, etc. But when I buy it as a gift, the employees at the liquor stores are very helpful. Will the grocery stores have a knowledgeable person in their store to help with selections? Secondly, will grocery stores be diligent in checking ID's like the liquor stores? Thirdly, why would the State get rid of something that generates millions of dollars in revenue?

In addition to the practice being ignorant from an ecological perspective, keeping up with tradition for tradition's sake even when they can't sell the meat to most Japanese people anymore makes zero economic sense. I think maybe the mayor of Shimonoseki needs to take a hard look at his life and culture if he can't find anything as happy as the day he sends his town's fleet off to slaughter some of the most sentient mammals on the planet. And please stop throwing the word """"research"""" around as though you have any concept of what that means--it's an insult to real cetacean biologists!
